workflow.name: Hackathon participant badge generator with QR code, PDF & email delivery
workflow.description:
# **Title**

**Hackathon Participant Badge Generator with QR Code & Email Delivery**

---

# **Description**

A fast, reliable, and fully automated workflow that generates **professional participant badges** for hackathons, tech events, and workshops ‚Äî complete with **unique Badge ID, QR verification, PDF output, and email delivery**.

This workflow takes any simple registration input and transforms it into a **verified, branded participant badge** in under 10 seconds.

---

## **What this workflow does**

* Accepts event registrations via a **POST Webhook** (name, email, event, team, role).
* Performs **input validation** and **disposable/fake email detection** using VerifiEmail.
* Creates a **unique Badge ID** (e.g., `HACK-2025-1763560499-AB3XYF`).
* Generates a **public verification URL** and **QR code** for check-in.
* Builds a **high-resolution badge** (1056√ó816px) with event branding, logo, gradient background, and QR code.
* Converts the HTML badge design into a **print-ready PDF** using PDFMunk (htmlcsstopdf).
* Sends a **beautiful HTML email** via Gmail that includes:

  * Inline badge preview (visible immediately)
  * Attached PDF badge
  * Verification URL + Badge ID
* Logs all badge metadata to **Google Sheets** for audit and check-in tracking.
* Returns a clean **JSON success response** to the caller.

---

## **Use Cases**

Ideal for:

* Hackathons & tech conferences
* Engineering fests & competitions
* Workshops, meetups, bootcamps
* Any event requiring verified digital badges with QR check-in

---

## **Key Features**

* **Real-time email verification** blocks fake/disposable registrations.
* **QR code check-in** powered by a reliable public QR API.
* **Fully customizable badge design** ‚Äî swap logos, colors, fonts easily.
* **Inline email preview** means participants see their badge instantly.
* **Complete event log** stored in Google Sheets with timestamps, PDF links, and verification URLs.
* **Extendable** (add Slack alerts, Drive uploads, role-based templates, etc.)

---

## **Setup Instructions (5 Minutes)**

1. Add your credentials:

   * VerifiEmail
   * PDFMunk (HTML ‚Üí PDF)
   * Gmail
   * Google Sheets
2. Update your:

   * Logo URL
   * Verification domain
3. Activate the workflow and start sending POST requests to the Webhook.
4. Badges will be generated and emailed automatically ‚Äî no manual work needed.

---

## **Why this workflow is special**

It‚Äôs built for **speed, reliability, visual quality, and zero manual overhead**.
Participants receive a sleek, branded badge instantly, organizers get automated logs, and your event gets a professional identity.

Perfect for teams who want **enterprise-grade badge automation** without writing a single line of code.

---

## **Tags**

hackathon, badge, qr-code, pdf, email, gmail, automation, participant, event, check-in, google-sheets

workflow.name: Hackathon Participant Badge + QR Check-in (HTML ‚Üí PDF ‚Üí Gmail)

parameters.message:
=

Hi {{ $('Validate Input').item.json.name.split(" ")[0] }},

Congratulations! Here is your official participant badge for:

{{ $('Validate Input').item.json.event}}

Badge ID: {{ $('Generate Badge ID & URL').item.json.badgeId }}
Verify Online: Click here to verify

Print the attached PDF or show it on your phone at check-in.
The QR code links directly to your verification page.

See you at the hackathon!
The {{ $('Validate Input').item.json.event }} Team
parameters.subject: =Your Official {{ $('Validate Input').item.json.event }} Badge

parameters.content:
### **CREDENTIALS REQUIRED**

* VerifiEmail at verifi.email
* HTML ‚Üí PDF at https://pdfmunk.com
* Gmail 
* Google Sheets

# Hackathon Badge Workflow

### **HACKATHON BADGE WORKFLOW ‚Äì FULLY AUTOMATED**

**Webhook ‚Üí Validate ‚Üí Email Check ‚Üí Generate ID + QR ‚Üí HTML ‚Üí PDF ‚Üí Gmail + Sheets ‚Üí Done**

**What it does:**

* Receives registration via POST
* Blocks fake/disposable emails
* Instantly creates PDF badge with QR
* Emails inline preview + PDF attachment
* Logs all details to Google Sheets

# Validation Group ‚Äî Validation & Safety

## **VALIDATION & SAFETY (Blocks junk early)**

**1. Validate Input**

* Checks required fields: name, email, event
* Rejects incomplete or invalid formats

**2. VerifiEmail Node**

* Real-time deliverability + disposable check
* Only valid emails continue

**3. Email Valid? (IF Node)**

* **True:** continue
* **False:** optional rejection path

#  Badge Creation Group ‚Äî *Badge Creation*

## BADGE CREATION 

**1. Generate Badge ID & URL**
* Creates unique ID + verifyUrl
* Generates QR code link
* Sets formatted issue date

**2. HTML to PDF**
* Returns ready PDF URL

# Delivery & Logging Group

## DELIVERY & LOGGING

**1. Download PDF**
* Fetches final badge PDF

**2. Send Badge via Gmail**
* Inline badge preview + PDF attachment
* Polished HTML email

**3. Log to Sheets**
* One row: Name, Email, Team, Badge ID, Verify URL, PDF link

**4. Success Response**
* JSON confirmation returned to caller

user.name: Jitesh Dugar
user.bio: AI Automation Specialist - OpenAI, CRM & Automation Expert with a solid understanding of various tools that include Zapier, Make, Zoho CRM, Hubspot, Google Sheets, Airtable, Pipedrive, Google Analytics, and more.

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
